etymologies: late 19th century (originally US): figuratively, from an early use denoting a hired Chinese assassin

definitions: a person employed to carry out controversial or disagreeable tasks, such as the dismissal of a number of people from employment

examples.text: he sent over his ace hatchet man to intimidate the business leaders

shortDefinitions: person employed to carry out controversial or disagreeable tasks, such as dismissal of several people from employment

definitions: a person who writes fierce attacks on others or their work

examples.text: he has abandoned the pretense that he is an impartial reporter—he is a hatchet man of the far right

shortDefinitions: person who writes fierce attacks on others
